programme.title: Gudrun - A' Bhana-phrionnsa Lochlannach
programme.desc: The autumn chill is turning the forest gold when King Sigurd takes Gudrun to gather nuts for a feast. But after Gudrun falls asleep beside a tree, she awakes to find her basket empty. She's not the only one gathering nuts for the winter.

programme.title: Peataichean
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack meets young pet owners who show how they care for, play and interact with their pets at home. Eilidh is joined by Sophie and her guinea pigs, Timmy and Max.

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach
programme.desc: Fox and Hare are throwing a costume party. Everybody is having fun and the friends have done their very best to look as festive as possible.

programme.title: Shane an Chef
programme.desc: Shane faces a tough culinary challenge when he attempts to make a salad that Mario will actually like! However, everything is thrown into disarray when Magaidh's new prize pig escapes to the village.

programme.title: Treud na Dlùth-choille: Grad-Naidheachd
programme.desc: A special adventure awaits those brave enough to follow Oigear underwater.

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: Seren and Ela are searching for clues around the garden to find Hari, and Ela goes in search of a mobile phone with Ben's help.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Ewen Henderson reads "Sgeulachd Bruis-fhiaclan" by MG Leonard, illustrated by Daniel Rieley and translated into Gaelic by Jo Macdonald.

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich
programme.desc: After falling asleep during her first visit to the forest, Ronja wakes up surrounded by dwarfs that seem threatening.

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Luana has been playing football for a long time but is the only girl who trains locally. She wants to form a girls team at her school and although she manages this, they struggle to make their mark without the required amount of members.

programme.title: A' Chùil
programme.desc: Choirstaidh is making a sign, and other things, out of string to decorate her studio.

programme.title: Facal Gaidhlig CBBC ALBA
programme.desc: Calum Macdonald introduces a selection of his favourite Gaelic words.

programme.title: An t-Eilean
programme.desc: The first calf sale of the year is held in Portree, Fiona competes at a power-lifting event and students visit an interesting croft in Staffin.

programme.title: Speaking Our Language
programme.desc: Lessons in Gaelic for beginners by Rhoda MacDonald.

programme.title: Earrann Eachdraidh
programme.desc: History short looking at extraordinary women.

programme.title: An La
programme.desc: Local, national and international news from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Dreach Ùr
programme.desc: Shona buys a plain white desk in a charity shop and takes it to Rachel Mackay who uses colourful wallpaper and paint to make it fun and trendy. Shona also makes a recycling bin using papier-mâché, and a pencil holder from an old coffee tin. All great ideas for the office.

programme.title: Cumhachd a' Yoik
programme.desc: Seumas MacLetchie acquired a deep connection to the natural world from his father when he grew up on North Uist. Seumas makes the trip of a lifetime to meet Ingá-Máret, a Sami Yoik artist in Finnish Lapland, and learns about the persecution that the Sami people have endured.

programme.title: Trusadh
programme.desc: Gin's growing global popularity has been a remarkable success story in recent years. In 2016 £1.1 billion of gin was sold in the UK alone, with economic projections suggesting that gin sales will outstrip whiskey by 2020. Scotland has played a major part in it's revival with 73 different companies creating over 130 gins across the country.

programme.title: Dan
programme.desc: Catriona Murray talks about how poetry can evoke memories of a person. She reads "An Luchag 's an Cat" which immediately reminds her of her cousin who is no longer alive. She vividly remembers him reciting the poem as a young boy at the Mòd.

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: Drama Gaidhlig steidhichte ann an Leodhas. Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis.

programme.title: Slighe Anndra
programme.desc: John Carmichael explores the Church of Scotland in locations throughout Europe.

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum swims at the Falls of Lora, where River Etive meets the Firth of Lorne. Calum often looks for a challenge and tries to find locations that are remarkable and which other swimmers do not frequent. It is not unusual to see canoeists or divers in these waters.

programme.desc: A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Seo BBC Alba
programme.desc: A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Seo BBC Alba
programme.desc: A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Su Pic
programme.desc: It's very cold outside but it is vital that it is warm and toasty inside, as Crogaidh is expecting her chick to hatch any time soon.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco and Charlie are playing at Bing's house when Coco spots the measuring lines on the wall that show how Bing has grown. Flop measures Bing and he's bigger than the last time. When Bing can't reach his paper aeroplane, Coco offers to measure him again to check if he's really grown but they don't quite get the measuring ritual right and the new mark is lower than before. Bing gets scared that he's growing down and that if he keeps.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play nature explorers in Amma's garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden. When it's Bing's turn to find something red, he doesn't look carefully before he tries to pick a raspberry and pricks his finger.

programme.title: Treud na Dlùth-choille: Grad-Naidheachd
programme.desc: A special adventure awaits those brave enough to follow Oigear underwater.

programme.title: 'S E Iasg a Th'Annam
programme.desc: A loving moonfish introduces his hometown of Hawaii, shows off his round frame, and reveals that they are the only warm hearted fish in the world.

programme.title: Orain CBeebies
programme.desc: Seafaring songs from Carrie, Linda, Ruairidh and the CBeebies ALBA presenters.

programme.title: Leum is Danns
programme.desc: Dancing fun for pre-school children.

programme.title: Sù Shiùsaidh
programme.desc: Boof loses the toy Witzy's toy boat while playing with it.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Fiona Dunn reads "Leòmhann ann am Paris", written and illustrated by Beatrice Alemagna and translated into Gaelic by Donald John Macleod.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Follows the adventures of hungry and enthusiastic panda Po, as he continues his martial arts training and takes on new responsibilities in the palace with the Furious Five.

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Badminton is being played today and Fearchar is as unpleasant as ever.

programme.title: Saidheans Sporsail
programme.desc: Clean your rusty bike with cola and read secret messages with your own x-ray vision.

programme.title: Kerry is Kirsty
programme.desc: Cycling sisters Kerry and Kirsty MacPhee are just north of Tyndrum at Loch Lyon with hill-walker Colin MacLeod, whose bike is a means to an end for reaching more summits. Starting their route at the foot of Beinn Dorain, Colin has a slalom of rivers crossings lined up for the girls and they battle across fjords flowing down from the surrounding hills.

programme.title: Trusadh
programme.desc: The story of lockdown through the eyes of a selection of people from across Scotland, as well as viewpoints from other parts of the world, bringing the audience a unique insight through detailed personal accounts.

programme.title: Rocky Ros Muc

programme.desc: The autumn chill is turning the forest gold when King Sigurd takes Gudrun to gather nuts for a feast. But after Gudrun falls asleep beside a tree, she awakes to find her basket empty. She's not the only one gathering nuts for the winter.

programme.title: Padraig Post
programme.desc: It's almost time for the school spring play but they are still missing a costume: a special yeti suit that SDS have promised to deliver in good time. However, Pat ends up making more than one delivery on this particular round.

programme.title: Bruadar a' Bhais
programme.desc: Before he was hanged for murder in 1831, young Hugh Macleod was paraded through the streets of Inverness in chains, jeered by a crowd of 3,000. He was the only defendant in Scottish legal history whose trial had admitted the evidence of second sight. Macleod was a native of remote Assynt in Sutherland. A schoolteacher, he was driven by an obsession for fine clothes and a fondness for reckless living.

programme.title: Seòid a' Chidsin
programme.desc: The lads head out of the kitchen to the Isle of Harris and visit Roddy's father for some of his delicious home-grown machair potatoes. They also spend time with his cousin on the beach, raking for cockles to use in his version of New England chowder. Along the coast at a small village harbour, Uisdean sources fresh seafood straight from the deck of a local fishing boat for a South American-inspired Jambalaya.

programme.title: Slighean Sgoile an t-Saoghail
programme.desc: When the schoolchildren wake up to the first rays of sunshine, the temperature is already over 30 degrees Celsius. They live in the Danakil Desert in north east Ethiopia, near an active volcano, in a region that is the world's hottest on average.

programme.title: Is Mise an Teanga
programme.desc: Documentary about the Gaelic language, its contemporary poets and their encounters with a hundred visual artists in "Leabhar Mor na Gaidhlig" (The Great Book of Gaelic), a Book of Kells for our time. The film travels the territory - from the Outer Hebrides to inner Dublin, to Connemara and the streets of West Belfast and Glasgow. We meet a group of extraordinary poets encountering the world of the contemporary artist.

Are 'guessing shows" here to stay?

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Kidnappers have seized more than a thousand students and staff from schools in a series of raids across northern Nigeria. The wave of abductions has devastating consequences for the country, which already has the highest number of children out of education anywhere in the world. Parents face extortionate demands in exchange for the freedom of their sons and daughters, and many families in Africa's most populous nation are now too afraid to send their children to class.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery that has a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent, and we return to Nottinghamshire to catch up with a couple who bought a former farm building at auction.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a lethal shooting from 1937, when a barge captain was allegedly murdered by his best friend. Felixstowe Docks, 1937. On 23 October the deceased body of barge skipper Albert Baker was found below deck aboard his vessel. He had been shot three times at close range with his own pistol, one that needed reloading after each shot had been fired.

programme.title: Bad Influencer: The Great Insta Con
programme.desc: The shocking story of the rise and fall of one of Instagram's first super-influencers. By 23, Australian wellness guru Belle Gibson had cultivated an adoring global following online with the story that she had successfully treated her own terminal cancer by eating a plant-based diet and using alternative natural therapies. But there was one problem with Belle's story: she had never had cancer.

programme.title: Thierry Henry: My France, My Euros
programme.desc: Former French international footballer Thierry Henry presents this thought-provoking documentary which focuses on the stories of Euros gone by and the social and cultural impact football has across Europe. As France prepares to host the Euros following the recent Paris attacks, Henry explores how something as simple as football can unify a nation and bring people together to celebrate diversity.

They found their villa engulfed by flames and realised that their upper-class employer Emma Keyse was missing.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a lethal shooting from 1937, when a barge captain was allegedly murdered by his best friend. Felixstowe Docks, 1937. On 23 October the deceased body of barge skipper Albert Baker was found below deck aboard his vessel. He had been shot three times at close range with his own pistol, one that needed reloading after each shot had been fired.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Kidnappers have seized more than a thousand students and staff from schools in a series of raids across northern Nigeria. The wave of abductions has devastating consequences for the country, which already has the highest number of children out of education anywhere in the world. programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A Victorian house in London's Crystal Palace, a charming chalet bungalow in Rackheath near Norwich and large end terrace house in Canterbury in Kent are sold at auction. programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Top criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a complex case from Victorian Britain that featured four prime suspects, two trials and ultimately just one man hanged for the murder of his neighbour. Norfolk, 1882. During the early hours of 19 November, in the narrow rows of Great Yarmouth, police on the beat noticed the door of one of the street's shops ajar. They searched the property and made a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a lethal shooting from 1937, when a barge captain was allegedly murdered by his best friend. Felixstowe Docks, 1937. On 23 October the deceased body of barge skipper Albert Baker was found below deck aboard his vessel. He had been shot three times at close range with his own pistol, one that needed reloading after each shot had been fired.

programme.title: Bad Influencer: The Great Insta Con
programme.desc: The shocking story of the rise and fall of one of Instagram's first super-influencers. By 23, Australian wellness guru Belle Gibson had cultivated an adoring global following online with the story that she had successfully treated her own terminal cancer by eating a plant-based diet and using alternative natural therapies. But there was one problem with Belle's story: she had never had cancer.

programme.title: Thierry Henry: My France, My Euros
programme.desc: Former French international footballer Thierry Henry presents this thought-provoking documentary which focuses on the stories of Euros gone by and the social and cultural impact football has across Europe. As France prepares to host the Euros following the recent Paris attacks, Henry explores how something as simple as football can unify a nation and bring people together to celebrate diversity.

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: David Farrell and Amy Irons meet the cast of the new Fast and Furious movie, Fast and Furious 9 and talk to John Cena, Vin Diesel, Nathalie Emmanuel and director Justin Lin about the Edinburgh car chase. Also catching up with Josh Gad, aka Olaf from Frozen about series 2 of animated musical "Central Park'. And, climbing aboard the Tall Ship with 'sea shanty guy" Nathan Evans as he reflects on six months that have seen him go from postman to releasing his first single.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family

They found their villa engulfed by flames and realised that their upper-class employer Emma Keyse was missing.

programme.desc: Live coverage of questions in the House of Commons to Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday 30 June.

programme.title: Political Highlights
programme.desc: Political and parliamentary highlights.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is in Gloucestershire at Nature in Art, the world's first museum and art gallery dedicated to art inspired by nature, as she goes in search of her inner muse. Under the expert eye of award-winning wildlife artist Jackie Cox, Ellie picks up some top tips including how old make-up can do just as good a job as fancy pencils.

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust is assessing the aftermath of the pandemic and its long-term impact. The Trust needs to adapt to a 'new normal' of massive waiting lists, new funding challenges and the growing realisation of Covid-19's long term effects on affected patients. At last, the plastic surgery department is finally able to start elective operations again. Except for emergencies, the department has not been able to perform these surgeries during the pandemic.

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: An 85-year-old man is owed thousands by a roofing company who failed to pay the money a court awarded him. Sheriffs James and Mark try to persuade the company director to pay up. Luke and Grant take possession of a London shop selling beauty products after the owner fails to pay his supplier.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Two of the UK's top criminal barristers, Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC, investigate a case from 1922 in which a lowly hotel pantry boy was convicted for the murder of a titled lady. On 13 March 1922, after an evening playing cards, wealthy widow Lady Alice White retired to bed at the Spencer Hotel in Marylebone. During the night she was subjected to a brutal assault, and the following morning a chambermaid discovered her covered in blood and clinging to life.

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Brian and Carole are being neighbourly in Beechgrove as they swap stories over the fence between Brian's Alpine garden and Carole's seaside garden. Meanwhile, find out what difference two months makes to one of the most glorious gardens in Scotland.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As midsummer approaches, it's the perfect time for Monty to place succulents outside at Longmeadow, as well as planting out dahlias and tender vegetables. Carol Klein visits Trebah Garden in Cornwall, where she finds plants which can add early summer pazazz to our borders. Nick Bailey is at RHS Wisley to look at a variety of shrubs that can be used as alternatives to traditional box hedging. We travel to the seaside in Kent to meet a group of gardeners who have transformed a public space.

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tulsen Tollett presents highlights and analysis from the latest round of matches in Super League. Champions St Helens have again been impressive in the early months of the season, but they face a tricky trip to Hull Kingston Rovers, who themselves have been in good form so far this year. Catalans are away to Castleford, Wigan travel to Wakefield and Salford are at home to Leeds.

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Kym Marsh presents an appeal on behalf of the Lullaby Trust, a charity that offers emotional and practical support to families who have lost a young child.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn and panel discuss the big issues of the day.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Live: Wimbledon Tennis
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents live coverage from Wimbledon 2021, which is making a welcome return after being cancelled in 2020 due to the pandemic.

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests round up the main action and talking points from today's play at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Victoria Wood's Secret List
programme.desc: This tribute continues to unveil Victoria's favourite moments and is chock full of indelible sketches, including Shoe Shop, Two Soups and Acorn Antiques, plus matchless comic big belters At The Chippy and, of course, The Ballad of Barry and Freda AKA Let's Do It.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: One-Day International Cricket
programme.desc: Highlights of the first one-day international between England and Sri Lanka.

programme.title: Statue Wars: One Summer in Bristol
programme.desc: On Sunday 7th June 2020, sparked by the horrific murder of George Floyd in Minneapolis, protestors marching to support the Black Lives Matter movement tore down the statue of slave trader Edward Colston and threw it in the city's harbour. Caught in the eye of this storm was Bristol's mayor Marvin Rees, the first directly elected mayor of Black African heritage of a major European city.

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom rolls up his sleeves in rural Cumbria, working alongside the veterinary surgeons who ensure that our farm animals and furry friends are healthy, no matter the circumstances. He learns why the health of our livestock is vital to keeping the country fed, helps to keep working animals like horses in tip-top condition, and assists the vets who provide round-the-clock care when our favourite companions are unwell. His mentor is David Black, managing director of Paragon Veterinary Group.

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris and Michaela hope to see the rare turtle dove in Norfolk, Gillian gets close to young Manx shearwaters in Northern Ireland and Iolo ducks into the river at Alladale to look for lampreys.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Jeremy Dein QC and Sasha Wass QC reinvestigate a lethal shooting from 1937, when a barge captain was allegedly murdered by his best friend. Felixstowe Docks, 1937. On 23 October the deceased body of barge skipper Albert Baker was found below deck aboard his vessel. He had been shot three times at close range with his own pistol, one that needed reloading after each shot had been fired.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles heads to King's Lynn for today's show. With the expert help of Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey, the red and blue teams scour Norfolk's biggest antiques centre to see who can buy the most profitable three items to take to auction. Eric also discovers how Kings Lynn became a medieval boom town by forming an alliance with a powerful European trading giant.

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Hoping to strike a deal are the musical inventor of a drumming training device and an LA-born entrepreneur with a culinary alcohol product range. There is also a first-aid demonstration by four children who hope to boost their parents' chances of investment. Finally, a prototype shoe mechanism is sized up by the Dragons.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn and panel discuss the big issues of the day.

programme.title: Live: Wimbledon Tennis
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further live coverage from Wimbledon, where the world's best tennis players are doing battle on the famous grass courts of the All England Club.

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests round up the main action and talking points from today's play at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts follows a decade-long historical quest to reveal a hidden secret of the famous bluestones of Stonehenge. Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists led by Prof Mike Parker Pearson have painstaking compiled evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in knowledge of the bluestones, and to show that the original stones of Britain's most iconic monument had a previous life.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Emily Maitlis.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: John McEnroe Still Rockin' at 60
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents an intimate profile of one of sport's most famous characters, John McEnroe, who is still controversial as he enters his 60th year. Sue travels to John's New York home and meets his childhood friends, brothers Mark and Patrick, daughters Anna, Ava, Ruby and his wife Patty Smyth.

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Kirsty, Brian and George are all focused on people gardening in smaller spaces. Kirsty plants up a range of trendy containers with plants to attract pollinators while George is growing quick crops in small spaces.

programme.title: Inside Culture with Mary Beard
programme.desc: Mary Beard hands over the reins to cultural historian Shahidha Bari. She explores the importance of self-expression: from the clothes people wear to the art and music they make. Shahidha visits artist Tracey Emin in her home town of Margate.

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Michaela and Chris investigate how British hedgehogs are coping this spring, and Megan McCubbin joins them live in Norfolk to discuss efforts to save the corncrake. Iolo is in the Scottish Highlands, checking on some very special wildcats.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross is at Nottingham Racecourse, with Thomas Plant and Nick Hall on hand as the antiques advisors. An exhilarating auction sees the two teams make profits galore.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery that has a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent, and we return to Nottinghamshire to catch up with a couple who bought a former farm building at auction.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: In 2017, Lei Ying and her husband, David, snapped up a Belfast house after seeing the amount of space it could offer them. However, three years later and with their children growing fast, they have discovered that having lots of space is not always a good thing, especially when it's all in the wrong place. The layout means that mealtimes are spent in a tiny, stressful corner of the ground floor, and when they want to relax, the cavernous lounge is too big to be cosy.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn and panel discuss the big issues of the day.

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding and guests round up the main action and talking points from today's play at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Being Frank: The Frank Gardner Story
programme.desc: In June 2004, BBC security correspondent Frank Gardner was shot six times by Al-Qaeda gunmen whilst reporting on growing terrorist activity in Saudi Arabia. The bullets damaged his spinal nerves, at the age of 43, Frank was left partially paralysed.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: One-Day International Cricket
programme.desc: Highlights of the second one-day international between England and Sri Lanka.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The three finalists compete for the title of Britain's best amateur sewer, taking on a trio of challenges for special occasions. Bringing together a range of advanced sewing skills, from couture techniques to the handling of delicate luxury fabrics, perfecting occasion wear is a pinnacle for any home sewer. Judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young start by challenging the sewers to make a little girl's bridesmaid dress.

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Sheriffs Ben and Myles are forced to call the police when they are confronted by a hostile crowd at a used-car dealership in Yorkshire that sold a defective vehicle. Luke and Carl visit a gold plating company in search of money owed to an out of pocket customer, and when an architect fails to pay a five-figure sum to a decorator, the sheriffs have a tricky job finding assets to cover the debt.

programme.title: Dom Digs In
programme.desc: Dom lifts the lid on what really happens to Britain's waste, finding out how our non-recyclable rubbish is turned into energy to power our homes and businesses. He's up bright and early with a waste collection team before following the rubbish from our wheelie bins to a waste transfer station, where he rummages through the refuse and confirms what's recyclable and what's not.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Leading criminal barristers Sasha Wass QC and Jeremy Dein QC explore a notorious case of a house servant accused of murdering his upper-class employer. Devon, 1884. In the early hours of a cold November morning, in picturesque Babbacombe Bay, servants at the Glen manor house awoke to the smell of smoke. They found their villa engulfed by flames and realised that their upper-class employer Emma Keyse was missing.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ballinderry plays host with Anita Manning at the helm, along with experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper. Anita also pays a visit to Lisburn Cathedral to find out more about a daring feat of a local suffragette.

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris and Michaela round up 2021's nest cameras in Norfolk. Iolo heads to the Moray Firth to check on dolphins, and Gillian encounters basking sharks in Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: In Dover, Alice Roberts relives the glamour days of the hovercraft crossing to France. programme.desc: The unlikely tale of how two Welsh farming brothers turned their dairy farm into one of the most successful recording studios of all time, producing four decades of legendary rock music from Black Sabbath, Queen, The Stone Roses, Oasis and Coldplay.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nicholas Crane explores the beautiful coastal area of Strangford Lough in Northern Ireland, and, with the help of zoologist Miranda Krestovnikoff, he discovers the significance of the tidal torrent and marine species.

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara is joined by presenter Ranvir Singh, comedians Micky Flanagan and Reginald D Hunter, and comedian and actor Sophia Willan. They will all be sharing their favourite books as well as reviewing this week's two book club picks: Big Hitter from 2020, "Shuggie Bain' by Douglas Stuart, and new book pick, `The Frequency of Us" by Keith Stuart.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: China Open
programme.desc: The definitive guide to the markets in Hong Kong and on the mainland; Rishaad Salamat, David Ingles, Tom Mackenzie and Yvonne Man bring the latest news and analysis to start the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets" banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This Asian-focused version is hosted by Shery Ahn, David Ingles, Haidi Lun, Rishaad Salamat and Angie Lau. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make investment decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Rare 1908 Gold Coin
programme.desc: Add the 1908 No Motto Saint Gaudens Gold Double Eagle Graded in Mint State 64 condition to your coin collection. This is the original design by Augustus Saint Gaudens and is the last year this stunning gold coin was released in the No Motto variety.

programme.title: Rare 1908 Gold Coin
programme.desc: Add the 1908 No Motto Saint Gaudens Gold Double Eagle Graded in Mint State 64 condition to your coin collection. This is the original design by Augustus Saint Gaudens and is the last year this stunning gold coin was released in the No Motto variety.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe" joins the network's morning lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Manus Cranny and Anna Edwards host the show from London, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show -- which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone -- as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Early Edition
programme.desc: Bringing insight on global markets and the top business stories of the day from New York and London.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Early Edition
programme.desc: Bringing insight on global markets and the top business stories of the day from New York and London.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Live from London and New York, with insight on global markets and top business stories of the day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Live from London and New York, with insight on global markets and top business stories of the day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Live from London and New York, with insight on global markets and top business stories of the day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: The Open
programme.desc: Jonathan Ferro takes viewers through the market-moving events from around the world during the most important hour of the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets" banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This American-focused version reports on the latest business news and features interviews with political and business leaders to help investors make investment decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show -- which airs in the morning U.S. time -- during the network's "Bloomberg Markets" daytime programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents -- Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London -- who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day's biggest news.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on the intersection of politics and global business.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: The most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: The Close
programme.desc: The final minutes and seconds before the closing bell on Wall Street with the latest news, data and expert analysis.

programme.title: What'd You Miss?
programme.desc: People are busy in today's fast-paced world and may miss news from the financial world that affects their investments. "What'd You Miss" provides key insights, analysis and context at the closing bell. Bloomberg TV's flagship markets program is a counterintuitive, highly intelligent look at the markets that misses absolutely nothing.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia
programme.desc: Bloomberg continues the expansion of its "Daybreak" franchise with this version that includes reporting from New York and Sydney, Australia. "Daybreak: Australia" delivers news from the Australian market as well as developments from around the world that matter to decision-makers in the finance industry. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the U.S. the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, "Bloomberg Daybreak Asia" features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia
programme.desc: Bloomberg continues the expansion of its "Daybreak" franchise with this version that includes reporting from New York and Sydney, Australia. "Daybreak: Australia" delivers news from the Australian market as well as developments from around the world that matter to decision-makers in the finance industry. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the U.S. the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, "Bloomberg Daybreak Asia" features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

Vlad senses Erin is in danger and when he gets to her she tells him about Bertrand, Ryan and the book.

programme.title: The Real Jamie Johnson

Having been chosen to join a top academy on the mainland he's preparing to move to Glasgow permanently, but not before playing in the most important annual match on the island.

programme.desc: In this doo wop number, the Potatoes dress up in special ways. They get ready for a party and just try on silly costumes.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say "grass", and goes on a whirlwind word adventure. See lots of grass: green grass, soft grass, spikey grass, growing grass and mowing grass.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog and Pug join Granny Pug in search of the Lesser-Spotted Kraken. Although they have a wonderful submarine, the Kraken is very clever and can camouflage itself. Our friends use a sandwich to draw the animal out and get some great photos.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando experiment with Bing's toy train on the Fun Fort in the playground. The train is good at going over bridges and brilliant at going down the slide. But when Bing slides it off the roof of the playhouse, the train crashes and breaks. Bing is upset until he realises that the pieces fit together to make something completely different.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch a lady trying to make a picnic bench, fitting planks of wood together. Her dog comes to tell her it is time for a walk and the Twirlywoos start fitting pieces together, but they may be making something completely different.

programme.title: Something Special

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: It's a scorcher of a day. Luckily Duggee has a big paddling pool. Yippee. First of all, they need help with blowing up the pool and filling it with water. Thank goodness for Ethel the elephant, she can do everything.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: On her way to Monster Art class, Meepa takes a tumble and hurts her hand. After a visit to Nurse Sneezle, she realises it's good to help monsters who feel poorly and becomes Class Nurse for the day.

programme.title: B.O.T. and The Beasties
programme.desc: To complete this mission B.O.T. must chase after a choir of Singing Fluffs as they keep floating away from the tuneless Flying Squawker, who is keen to join in with their singing.

programme.title: Andy's Baby Animals
programme.desc: Andy Day takes a look at young animals as they learn important skills. A young sea otter watches mum crack a shellfish open, while Capuchin monkeys learn how to break into yummy nuts. And an elephant calf learns how to use its trunk.

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Sheba transforms into a magical rainbow as Aimee and Mae perform the famous "Over the Rainbow" from the Wizard of Oz in British Sign Language, accompanied by animations.

programme.title: Olobob Top
programme.desc: Bobble won't stop playing the "copying game" until Fobble appears and copies him, so the Olobobs make Pobble who loves being copied, which is a relief to everyone!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, a special thing that only they can do. Bing is frustrated when all his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do too. When Pando accidentally hurts Bing's ear they are all in for a surprise, as Bing discovers he does have a knack that no-one else can do.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po gets on the Custard Train and makes lots of tubby custard, far too much for Po to eat alone. Po choo-choos off to find Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa so all the Teletubbies can share in the tubby custard.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tee's friend Lily the Tiger has come over to play her favourite game: surprise. The two attempt to surprise Mo.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Following the adventures of trainee engines Koko, Wilson, and Brewster, as they learn important lessons like cooperation, perseverance and respect.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag their favourite things around the house with heart-shaped stickies. Sometimes they have different favourites and sometimes their favourite things are the same. But when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh, Bing is upset because Hoppity is his most favourite of favourites and he's not sure he wants to share him.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him his favourite book as he has his bath, but Bing joins in with the story too enthusiastically. Flop suggests they finish the story in bed as books don't like baths. When the book falls into the bath, Bing is heartbroken, but Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet the story isn't.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels meet a little worm who has swallowed a bit too much earth and has got the hiccoughs. The Squirrels think this is hilarious until they get the hiccoughs too. Hic hic. Let's hope Duggee doesn't get them too.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is cleaning out the workshop but he needs the Squirrels' help. The squirrels work hard but when they finish they can't find Duggee. Oh! They have built a maze out of all the things in Duggee's workshop. Duggee is right in the middle of the maze, but can the squirrels find the right way in? And once they're in, can they find the way out again?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad and the kids decide to go on a journey to their local creek after getting bored of the local playground. Although out of her comfort zone, Bluey's eyes are opened to the beauty of the natural world.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad brings Bluey and Bingo on a wagon ride to the park, and Bluey is keen to try the monkey bars. Her patience is tested when Dad continues to stop and chat with other grown-ups.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: When Grandmaster Glitch takes the quadriga from the Brandenburg Gate, the Go Jetters must stop him before he reaches Grim HQ.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: With his father's journal and the help of his best friends Benjamin and Lily, Peter is ready for some fun and delightful new discoveries.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts study a group of baby hammerhead sharks as they hunt on their own for the first time and poke their noses into trouble.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-One reveals her six-step plan for figuring out Numberblocks, and takes some friends along for the ride. Learn different ways to explore the properties of a number with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: On Invent Something New Day, Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny and Love Monster realise that sometimes, two heads are better than one.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: It is bedtime for A, E, I, O and U, but vowels will be vowels and there is no getting them to snuggle down. L's lullaby usually does the trick, but she needs a little help from her friends.

programme.title: Kit and Pup
programme.desc: Let's find out about the world with Kit and Pup! Today Kit and Pup are exploring the opposites Open and Close. They start by trying to pack a suitcase. Pup manages to close it neatly, but then Kit overloads it with clothes and the suitcase keeps popping open. Kit and Pup then try to find as many things being opened and closed as they can. In the live-action investigation Kit and Pup help the little investigators find matching pictures of open and closed objects.

programme.title: Maddie, the Home and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the Eco Village to discover how houses can be built in different ways. Using a map to find the way, Maddie discovers how houses can be built using recycled materials and how energy can be harnessed from the sun and wind to use in the home.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Mo wants to take a new picture of Tee for her wall, but Tee is too distracted by pictures of bugs to pose for the camera.

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: In this song inspired by the Beach Boys, the gang enjoy playtime after school and every day.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say "treasure", and goes on a whirlwind word adventure. Find lots of different treasure: gold treasure, royal treasure, sunken treasure, jungle treasure and even yummy treat treasure.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog and Pug are trying to solve one of the world's great mysteries, and they meet Granny Pug trying to track down the Yeti. They are caught up in an avalanche, and although they see many things, they never find the Yeti. Or do they?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula. He's thrilled until it's time to hand it over as he decides he wants to keep it for himself.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: An artist is drawing a dog in a room. The dog wants to go out, so the artist opens the door. After a while, the artist opens the door again and calls the dog back inside. The Twirlywoos decide to open and close the door to let the dog in and out.

programme.title: Something Special: We're All Friends
programme.desc: Justin and his friends go on a treasure hunt. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble has baked a cake for Aunt Polly's birthday, but the cake ends up having an adventure all of its own.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies wait for tubby toast, then they wait for the Tubby Phone to be answered and finally they wait for the Tiddlytubbies to go to sleepy byes. A boy in Tummy Tales waits to cross a road with his grandad and waits for a bus.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Willow, Isobel, Lincoln, Ezra, Noah, Jason and their grown-ups. Inside everyone's bags are building blocks which are explored through discovery, play, song and story.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: It's a very hot day and Duggee's flowers are looking very sad. They need some water but there's not a drop to be found. How can they make the rain come? What about the rain dance! Duggee teaches the squirrels the best rain dance ever and it really does work well.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Icklewoo is feeling really left out. She couldn't go to Wingston's party and then the other monsters decided to play without her. Mrs Grizzlesniff suggests she sits on the Buddy Bench so the other monsters will see she's lonely.

programme.title: B.O.T. and The Beasties
programme.desc: B.O.T. chases after the skilful Snowy Scoot as it skis at speed through the snow and ice. B.O.T. is not as graceful but is committed to collecting all the data.

programme.title: Andy's Baby Animals
programme.desc: Andy Day takes a look at young animals as they learn how to make a place to rest. Many young apes must learn how to make a bed out of leaves, and bar-headed geese make a soft, fluffy nest out of feathers on hard rock.

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk to a great place to draw some pictures using charcoal. On the way they spin like windmills, visit the burnt forest, climb a tree and even run from a dinosaur.

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Pink Bird dons a pair of dancing shoes in the Magic Hands rendition of "Wouldn't It Be Loverly' from `My Fair Lady", performed by Mae and Aimee in British Sign Language, accompanied by animations.

programme.title: Tik Tak
programme.desc: Moving patterns and simple cartoons for toddles, with the shadow man and the sheep.

programme.title: Let's Play
programme.desc: It's Sid's turn for a hectic shopping adventure when he steps through the Magic Curtain to be a supermarket worker. Sid arrives on a busy day at the supermarket and Mrs Clarke the manager is in need of his help. The store owner is on her way and everything needs to be shipshape when she arrives. Sid sets about his tasks enthusiastically but has he got what it takes to navigate through the perils of the job?

programme.title: Olobob Top
programme.desc: Gurdy is having lots of little ideas who appear and run all over the tree, so the Olobobs make Pie Piper who enchants the ideas and gives the Olobobs a yummy pie!

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: When Grandmaster Glitch builds his effigy in ice, his digging threatens the Lambert Glacier in Antarctica.

programme.title: Andy's Prehistoric Adventures
programme.desc: Andy jumps into his time-travelling clock and heads back three million years, where he runs into some ancient primates and joins their tribe. He helps them fend off a prehistoric big cat, before having his trusty backpack stolen by vultures.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Evie's mum, Jess, has just married Doug's dad, Simon. The new family get home to discover a lost puppy hiding in their wedding presents. Evie wants to keep him and call him Waffle.

programme.title: Old Jack's Boat
programme.desc: Emily does not know what to do with her delivery of tiny umbrellas and Jack tells the story of a very special delivery he once received.

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: When Timmy comes to play, he shows Tig how to draw monsters. Tig loves the drawings and puts them under her bed. At night, the monsters roar and wake her up. Woolly suggests changing the monsters into daytime monsters.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say "treasure", and goes on a whirlwind word adventure. Find lots of different treasure: gold treasure, royal treasure, sunken treasure, jungle treasure and even yummy treat treasure.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: L discovers that bath time is more fun when you double up. Then H and I hop in, and soon the tub is slip-sliding down a giant hill, picking up "Alphablocks" as it goes.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-One reveals her six-step plan for figuring out Numberblocks, and takes some friends along for the ride. Learn different ways to explore the properties of a number with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Pug wants to learn how to paint, so the heroes visit Picasso's studio in Paris. He persuades Picasso to become more abstract using a full colour palette. The rest is history.

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy thinks smelly socks and cheesy feet are brie-lliant! But when it's Lofty's feet that smell, it's a giant problem.

programme.title: Colours
programme.desc: Learn about objects that are associated with the colour pink, from marshmallows to flamingos, as well as explore the colour found in nature around the world. The episode concludes with a specially written poem.

programme.title: Something Special: We're All Friends
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a living museum to experience life in the olden days. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble has overslept because his alarm clock is broken, but he has a plan.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: It's a cold day in Teletubbyland, so cold that it's snowing. The Teletubbies find big snowballs, dance with a snowman and watch children make a caterpillar out of snow.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco's hula hoop. It's harder than it looks, but they all find lots of other hoopy games on the way. Just as Bing almost gets it right, he gets carried away with spinning and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset she can't hula anymore - until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch's giant ball game threatens El Castillo. It is up to the Go Jetters to bounce back and save it.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Timmy and Mittens are paired up to paint each other's portraits during an art session at the nursery. After a dispute about who will get the bigger paintbrush, they soon get into a messy paint situation.

programme.title: Footy Pups
programme.desc: Join international footballer Rachel Yankey and her team as they try to be right on target when learning about aiming. Meanwhile, it's a windy day at Pupton Park and the Footy Pups have to come up with a puppy plan to retrieve the footballs.

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace looks back at some of her favourite machines that are electric, fast and useful.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Cook and Line are laughing so much that they can barely salute the Captain. Captain Captain wants to know what's so funny. They tell her that Line told Cook a joke so funny that he almost fell overboard. The Captain thinks this is no laughing matter - what would they have done if they had really fallen overboard? Cook and Line are stumped. Captain Captain demands that they take her handbook and practice what to do if a pirate falls overboard.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Norrie is upset when she sees a leaf fall from the tree. She thinks it's broken. She soon cheers up when she finds out that some trees shed their leaves in autumn, and actually it's quite good fun playing and jumping in piles of leaves. But ouch! What has Roly found?

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Peter promises the Shrew some worms to entice him to Cotton-tail's birthday party, he ends up accidentally putting everyone in danger.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster promises to make the biggest mooncake ever, but he keeps getting distracted.

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: The gang sing a punk rock anthem about how wonderful it is to just be yourself and the importance of self love.

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: Andy embarks on a new aquatic adventure and blasts off in his safari sub to the Galapagos to see how sea lions deal with flies.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie is outdoors, finding out about things that use the wind. She finds out how a kite works when it flies high in the sky and uses a special device to measure the wind speed.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad and the kids decide to go on a journey to their local creek after getting bored of the local playground. Although out of her comfort zone, Bluey's eyes are opened to the beauty of the natural world.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch and his grimbots have a dangerous race on the Great Wall of China, weakening its structure. The Go Jetters have to save the wall before it crumbles to the ground.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack's Stall. She chooses the guitar plectrum and remembers the day she got it. When Mack sees a guitar on the music stall that looks just like his mum's old guitar.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle is banned from going anywhere near Sommersby School, so Gramps is at the Brooklyn-Bells' house to cheer him up. They play a game together on the front drive. Gramps and Waffle run in circles quickly, then slowly, before falling to the ground with laughter. Mrs Hobbs appears at her front door. She might have known it would be Gramps and Waffle making the racket. Mrs Hobbs reveals she's doggy day-caring Connie and Ruby's dog, Jelly. Gramps and Waffle can't believe it.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: When JoJo can't find her favourite Captain Chloe storybook, Gran Gran suggests they make up their own story. As they create their pirate quest, JoJo learns that when you make up your own story, you get to decide what happens next.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Sarah and Duck invite some friends over for a sleepover, but sleeping gets tougher than planned.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, all the friends are reading books together and thinking of their favourite stories. Colly Wobble's favourite story is a silly song about a 'Horsey in the House'! Who can resist joining in?

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Tiny is sneezing, she's not very well. Mother says bed and rest are best, but Small has a better idea, he thinks that music will do the trick. And he's right.

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Igglepiggle is skipping through the garden. Suddenly he lets out a very big sneeze. Soon Upsy Daisy and the Tombliboos are sneezing too. Makka Pakka is tidying his stones when he lets out a big sneeze too.

programme.desc: Frances Barber reads "A House in the Woods" by Inga Moore.

programme.title: Ninja Foodi Grill - The grill that sears, sizzles, and air fry crisps!
programme.desc: Grill all your favorites to juicy, char-grilled perfection indoors, without the smoke! In just minutes, grill frozen meats to quickly defrost and cook them at the same time. 75% less fat than traditional frying methods-enjoy guilt-free fried food.

programme.title: Floor Police Motorized Mop
programme.desc: Spin away dirt and germs with the lightweight Floor Police cordless power spin mop.

programme.title: Introducing Crepe Erase Advanced Formula!
programme.desc: Crepe Erase Advanced visibly transforms your skin with 9 super hydrators! Tune in to see how Courtney Thorne Smith & Jane Seymour keep their skin so smooth. Dr. Ordon shares how you can visibly treat & repair the look of crepey skin. CrepeErase.com.

programme.title: The PiYo Craze from Beachbody!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga, and fluid motion all-in-one!

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Valerie is inviting Angela Kinsey to relax and practice some self-care; roasted cod with cashew coconut lime; tangy quick collards; tomato and cucumber salad with a cumin vinaigrette.

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Valerie keeps up with her fast cats this morning by prepping a few make-ahead dishes; make-ahead pea soup with lemon mascarpone; vVinegar chicken with tomatoes and olives; cabbage salad.

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Ex-football player Colton Underwood now runs a non-profit to benefit people living with cystic fibrosis; mom's chicken cacciatore; classic antipasti green salad; lemon cake with lemon cream cheese frosting; garlicky polenta.

programme.title: Valerie's Home Cooking
programme.desc: Valerie Bertinelli hosts a fondue party for her friends, actors Melissa Peterman and John Brady; her menu includes four cheese fondue with assorted dippers, everyday sheet pan roasted veggies and chocolate dessert fondue with fried bananas.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: The usual rounds are replaced by breakfast, lunch and dinner; coffee cake and cream-filled chocolate eggs for breakfast; fish dishes for lunch; divine dinner basket.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: In the first round, a mighty midnight snack poses a creative challenge; a beer and a bird in round two; the dessert basket includes premium chocolate bars and Irish coffee.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Two fishy ingredients are featured in the appetizer basket; spiny leaves and beef kidneys must be combined; the dessert basket contains figs and lemon verbena.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: The appetizer basket contains beef tendon balls; in the entree round, fresh vermicelli noodles; caramelized onions in the dessert basket.

programme.title: Grill of Victory
programme.desc: Host Sabin Lomac challenges three amateur backyard grilling wizards to make breakfast, lunch and dinner on the grill; the competitors have to handle curveballs, like making lunchtime salad trios and stuffed entrees for dinner.

programme.title: BBQ Brawl
programme.desc: A true Master of 'Cue must have the ability to handle any challenge or cooking condition, so the competitors have to prove their ability to pivot; team captains Bobby Flay, Michael Symon and Eddie Jackson keep a close eye on their pitmasters.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Bobby Flay's pals come in hot from the West and East Coasts to take him down at his own game; Michael Symon wants to settle the score, as he pits New York chef Alex Guarnaschelli against LA chef Jet Tila in an all-out battle of friends.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Sunny Anderson ("The Kitchen") and kid chefs Gibson Borelli and Tyler Zager try to beat Bobby Flay; California restaurateur Claud Beltran and first-time dad Brian Santos strive for a one-on-one showdown with Bobby Flay.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Haylie Duff and Curtis Stone aim to knock their friend Bobby Flay down a couple of pegs; Washington, D.C., veteran Todd Gray and Maryland's French-trained Gabonese caterer Serge Pambo compete for a shot to go up against Bobby.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Naval chef Carla Harris brings her grit against seriously competitive chef Noah Schwartz; Anne Burrell and Geoffrey Zakarian use their expertise to determine who has the arsenal to beat Bobby.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Comedian Judy Gold teams up with Katie Lee for the chance to poke fun at their friend Bobby Flay; Las Vegas titan, Chef Alex Stratta, and Iranian chef Houman Gohary compete for the chance to take on Bobby.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Barbecue fusion master Robert Cho and over-the-top Brian Malarkey hunger for a win; Food Network's Sunny Anderson and chef Josh Capon serve one of the competitors up to Bobby Flay.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Worlds collide when Irish firecracker chef Maeve Rochford squares off against Indian cuisine enthusiast chef Navjot Arora; two of Food Network's finest, Alex Guarnaschelli and Damaris Phillips, decide who will confront Bobby Flay.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Giada De Laurentiis and Jess Cagle reach for the stars when they match up dynamic Greek chef Pano Karatassos and Mimi Weissenborn to take down Bobby Flay.

programme.title: RDI matin
programme.desc: Marc-André Masson vous offre toutes les informations dont vous avez besoin pour commencer votre journée. C'est un rendez-vous en prise directe avec les développements de l'actualité partout dans le monde et plus près de nous avec la contribution en direct de nos journalistes à Montréal, Québec, Ottawa/Gatineau, ainsi qu'en Acadie, en Estrie, au Saguenay ou ailleurs. En compagnie de Martine Defoy aux nouvelles, Julie Jasmine Boudreau à la météo et l'actualité culturelle et Jean St-Onge, aux sports.

programme.title: Les grands reportages

programme.title: La matinale
programme.desc: Pascale de la Tour Du Pin sera aux commandes La Matinale. Plusieurs nouveautés pour cette nouvelle saison, avec de nouveaux visages : Thierry Moreau (média), Christophe Beaugrand (buzz), le Dr Gérald Kierzek (santé) sans oublier Claire Fournier (éco), Benjamin Cruard (insolite), Guillaume Woznica (météo), et Bintily Diallo (Culture). L'information sera assurée par Axel Monnier.

programme.title: L'interview politique
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 8h30 et pendant 25 minutes, Christophe Jakubyszyn reçoit un invité politique ou un membre de la société civile de premier plan, afin d'évoquer l'actualité.

programme.title: LCI midi
programme.desc: Le point sur l'actualité à la mi-journée. Plusieurs éditorialistes sont invités à confronter leurs points de vue et la diffusion d'un grand reportage clôt l'émission.

programme.title: Perri scope
programme.desc: Le débat sur l'actualité économique aura toute sa place cette année sur LCI. Pascal Perri proposera chaque jour un débat sur un thème d'actualité économique qui fait polémique. Il aura chaque jour face à lui un contradicteur avec qui il débattra sans concessions et apportera toute son expertise.

programme.title: Le débat
programme.desc: Arlette Chabot invite un duo d'éditorialistes qui vont confronter leurs idées, s'affronter parfois, sur des sujets d'actualité.

programme.title: 24h Pujadas
programme.desc: David Pujadas apporte toute son expertise pour analyser l'actualité du jour dans cette nouvelle saison. Placée sous le signe de la pédagogie, elle est segmentée en deux parties : le Club Pujadas, comprenant une vingtaine de membres dont 3 ou 4 débattront des sujets du jour. Partis Pris s'articulera autour de 3 éditorialistes dont François Lenglet pour l'économie, Vincent Hervouët pour l'international et Christophe Jakubyszyn pour la politique où ils donneront leurs points de vue sur un sujet d'actualité.

programme.title: Le grand soir
programme.desc: Chaque soir, place à l'actualité politique et économique. La rubrique Le Grand Soir Eco s'intéressera à l'économie, un sujet qui intéresse de plus en plus les Français, devenus très familiers à ces enjeux.

programme.title: In the vault : mort sur le campus
programme.desc: À peine arrivée à l'université, une étudiante est retrouvée morte. Était-ce un suicide, un meurtre ? Aucune preuve à l'horizon, mais une atmosphère glaçante pour ce nouveau thriller aussi troublant que scotchant.

programme.title: Quantico
programme.desc: Après le meurtre d'un témoin-clé à l'approche du procès d'un chef de cartel, l'unité d'élite doit protéger un nouveau témoin en collaboration avec l'agent des US Marshalls Joel Akers. Ce témoin est Charlie Hill, un ancien agent de la CIA.

programme.title: Quantico
programme.desc: Un espion russe et ancien ennemi de Harry le prévient de l'assassinat imminent d'un émir sur le sol américain. L'unité d'élite ne peut empêcher une attaque contre le roi, mais découvre que la véritable cible était son fils, le jeune prince héritier.

programme.title: Quantico
programme.desc: De jeunes recrues du FBI se battent de toutes leurs forces sur le camp d'entraînement de Quantico en Virginie, entre tests d'endurance physique, cours de tir, et maîtrise de l'art de l'enquête et de l'interrogatoire.

programme.title: Tornade: l'alerte
programme.desc: Berlin croule sous une chaleur. Jan Berger est météorologiste et rentre tout juste des Etats-Unis où il a étudié le phénomène des cyclones. Jan craint des intempéries exceptionnelles dans la ville... Effectivement, à 300 km de la ville, une première tornade s'abat dans un champ, emportant un paysan. Une tempête extrêmement violente et soudaine surprend alors les berlinois. Jan essaie à tout prix de sauver cette population qu'il aime tant, fût-ce au péril de sa vie...

programme.title: BoJack Horseman
programme.desc: Le dîner snob de récolte de fonds pour la campagne de M.Peanutbutter prend une tournure terrifiante. Pendant la débandade, BoJack et Diane continuent de boire et se retrouvent complètement ivres.

programme.title: BoJack Horseman
programme.desc: Hollyhock commence à fréquenter avec un stagiaire de la série de BoJack. Princesse Carolyn quant à elle rencontre les parents de Ralph. M.Peanutbutter donne une consigne de vote pour Woodchuck.

programme.title: BoJack Horseman
programme.desc: Par une journée déplorable, Princesse Carolyn accumule rejet, mensonge et perte. BoJack et Diane essaient de retrouver le certificat de naissance de Hollyhock.

programme.title: BoJack Horseman
programme.desc: Diane fait fuiter une information préjudiciable à Jessica Biel. L'affaire de clowns-dentistes de Todd est en difficulté, et Princesse Carolyn trouve un espoir inattendu. Un problème survient lors des élections.

programme.title: Tornade: l'alerte
programme.desc: Berlin croule sous une chaleur. Jan Berger est météorologiste et rentre tout juste des Etats-Unis où il a étudié le phénomène des cyclones. Jan craint des intempéries exceptionnelles dans la ville... Effectivement, à 300 km de la ville, une première tornade s'abat dans un champ, emportant un paysan. Une tempête extrêmement violente et soudaine surprend alors les berlinois. Jan essaie à tout prix de sauver cette population qu'il aime tant, fût-ce au péril de sa vie...

programme.title: Let's Get Physical
programme.desc: Après le décès de son père surnommé le parrain de l'aérobique, Joe décide de reprendre le flambeau familial et de se confronter à son adversaire de toujours Barry Cross, un entrepreneur ayant fait fortune grâce à ses salles d'aérobique.

programme.title: In the vault : mort sur le campus
programme.desc: À peine arrivée à l'université, une étudiante est retrouvée morte. Était-ce un suicide, un meurtre ? Aucune preuve à l'horizon, mais une atmosphère glaçante pour ce nouveau thriller aussi troublant que scotchant.

programme.title: The Bad News Bears in Breaking Training
programme.desc: In this sequel, the Bears are invited to Houston to play against the Texas Little League champs in the famous Astrodome. However, one of their best players has a broken leg and cannot play. Also, the team's last manager has quit, and they have no replacement. While they are on the road, driver and outfielder Kelly Leak (Jackie Earle Haley) seeks out his divorced father, Mike (William Devane), who lives in Texas, to see if he will agree to become the team's new manager.

programme.title: Quick Pitch
programme.desc: Sometimes, fans of America's national pastime might miss a day or two of their favorite sport due to pesky things like work, a wedding anniversary, or a child's high-school graduation ceremony. Rest easy, devotees of the diamond -- MLB Network has you covered. "Quick Pitch" not only provides complete highlights of each game from the previous day, but also presents a glimpse at upcoming contests, including pitching matchups.

programme.title: Plays of the Week
programme.desc: Too bad this baseball show wasn't around back on May 26, 1993 -- the fly ball that bounced off Texas Rangers outfielder Jose Canseco's head and flew over the fence for a home run would have certainly made the cut. Not all highlights can be that entertaining, but this series collects equally amazing examples of big hits and fielding gems from the previous week.

programme.desc: Too bad this baseball show wasn't around back on May 26, 1993 -- the fly ball that bounced off Texas Rangers outfielder Jose Canseco's head and flew over the fence for a home run would have certainly made the cut. Not all highlights can be that entertaining, but this series collects equally amazing examples of big hits and fielding gems from the previous week.

programme.title: Quick Pitch
programme.desc: Sometimes, fans of America's national pastime might miss a day or two of their favorite sport due to pesky things like work, a wedding anniversary, or a child's high-school graduation ceremony. Rest easy, devotees of the diamond -- MLB Network has you covered. "Quick Pitch" not only provides complete highlights of each game from the previous day, but also presents a glimpse at upcoming contests, including pitching matchups.

programme.title: MLB Central
programme.desc: MLB Network's first-ever regular-season morning show features hosts Robert Flores, Mark DeRosa and Lauren Shehadi reporting from Studio 21, named in honor of Hall of Famer and humanitarian Roberto Clemente. Updates and context on the latest news, extensive on-field highlights, and long-form conversations with guests, celebrities and insiders from around baseball are presented each weekday morning. Flores joined the network in 2016 as a host/reporter, DeRosa offers a unique outlook as a former player, and Shehadi honed crisp interviewing skills during three years of hosting MLB Network's "The Rundown."

programme.title: High Heat
programme.desc: Chris Russo has never been afraid to bring the heat as a radio host. Nicknamed "Mad Dog," he shows real passion for sports when the subject is baseball. Hearing him rant on satellite radio is one thing; seeing him is electrifying, which is why MLB Network collared Mad Dog to talk hardball each weekday. The hourlong studio show begins with Russo's monologue on the day's big headlines, then accelerates to league news with a roster of contributors including analysts Al Leiter, Dan Plesac, Harold Reynolds, Bill Ripken, insider Tom Verducci, and national/local beat writers and broadcasters.

programme.title: MLB Now
programme.desc: The hourlong weekday afternoon "MLB Now" presents the day's top stories in baseball by spanning the sport's cultural divide. Host Brian Kenny discusses the issues and provides analysis, with a bent toward modern analytics to prove his points. The series also features interviews with personalities throughout the game, and viewer opinions are welcome as well via social media polls.

programme.title: The Rundown
programme.desc: The title says it all, as any good title should. "The Rundown" presents a jump-start to all that's happening each weeknight in Major League Baseball, including highlights, live look-ins to games in progress, and access to batting practice. There's also team reports, injury updates and the latest news regarding roster moves. Matt Yallof and Lauren Shehadi host.

programme.title: Intentional Talk
programme.desc: MLB Network's first-ever talk show is an open forum that features some talk and a lot of banter each weekday for host Kevin Millar, who discusses with special guests what's hot and what's not in and around the national pastime. He also runs out of the baseline at times by welcoming guests from the worlds of entertainment and pop culture to talk about trending topics in those arenas. Millar gained fame as a member of the 2004 world champion Boston Red Sox, and since he retired from the diamond his knowledge of the game and warm, affable personality have vaulted him into a lengthy career in the media.

programme.title: MLB Tonight
programme.desc: When they're not tuning in to the games themselves, baseball fans know where to turn for their nightly baseball fix. MLB Network's signature program, "MLB Tonight" presents complete coverage of all of the games, beginning with the first pitch on the East Coast and ending with the final out on the West Coast. The Emmy-winning studio show features highlights, live look-ins and breaking news, plus analysis from a rotating roster that includes former players Eric Byrnes, Al Leiter, Dan Plesac, Billy Ripken and Mike Lowell, and inside information men Tom Verducci, Jon Heyman, Peter Gammons and Ken Rosenthal. Greg Amsinger, Brian Kenny and Matt Vasgersian are among the hosts.

programme.desc: Los Angeles Angels at New York Yankees or Kansas City Royals at Boston Red Sox.

The Emmy-winning studio show features highlights, live look-ins and breaking news, plus analysis from a rotating roster that includes former players Eric Byrnes, Al Leiter, Dan Plesac, Billy Ripken and Mike Lowell, and inside information men Tom Verducci, Jon Heyman, Peter Gammons and Ken Rosenthal. Greg Amsinger, Brian Kenny and Matt Vasgersian are among the hosts.
